entry.title: Who Is Making Sure the A.I. Machines Aren’t Racist?
entry.quote: When Google forced out two well-known artificial intelligence experts, a long-simmering research controversy burst into the open.

entry.title: The Buzzy, Chatty, Out-of-Control Rise of Clubhouse
entry.quote: Paul Davison and Rohan Seth’s audio-only app is the tech crush of the pandemic. Now comes the hard part: hosting a global gabfest, without the toxicity.

entry.title: The uneasy intimacy of work in a pandemic year
entry.quote: How capitalism and the pandemic destroyed our work-life balance.

entry.title: The End of Silicon Valley as We Know It?
entry.quote: the inventions we most urgently need will take us in a very different direction than the consumer internet and social media revolution that is coming to an unsightly end.

entry.title: Photographer Spends 12 Years, 1250 Hours, Exposing Photo of Milky Way
entry.quote: Finnish astrophotographer J-P Metsavainio has released a Milky Way photo that took him nearly 12 years to create. The 1.7-gigapixel image has a cumulative exposure time of 1,250 hours.

entry.title: A Pandemic Winner: How Zoom Beat Tech Giants To Dominate Video Chat
entry.quote: Looking back, the 9-to-5, everybody needs to be in the same place at the same time during that window so you can pound on a computer for eight hours straight — that's in our rear view mirror
